author: Travis Simpson (noreply@couriernews.com)
title: Danville topples Lavaca 62-34
text: slideshow LAVACA — The Danville Little Johns defeated the Lavaca Golden Arrows 62-34 on Friday.Danville went up 12-0 in the first quarter on two touchdown runs by quarterback Jake Madding. Lavaca answered with a 15-yard run by Landon Graves.The Little Johns went up 18-7 on a 1-yard run by Madding, but the Golden Arrows pulled within 18-14 late in the first quarter.Madding — who finished the night with over 200 yards rushing and six touchdowns — scored from 24 yards out and added the 2-point conversion for good measure.The Little Johns scored next on a 58-yard interception returned by Parker Reece for a touchdown to make it 32-14.Madding scored next on a 15-yard run by Madding. Chris Thurman added the 2-point conversion to make it 40-20 at half.Danville added 22 more points in the third quarter. First Thurman scored on a 7-yard carry. Then Rhett Sullivan sacked the quarterback in the end zone for a safety. Madding scored on a 12-yard run.Lavaca scored on a 20-yard pass from Graves to Janson Graves.Jamey Holbrook scored the final Danville touchdown on a 56-yard run. Lavaca scored the lone touchdown of the fourth quarter to set the final score.Danville will host Lamar on Friday.
